required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: STEVIE: A Study of Vismodegib in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Basal Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Open-label, Phase II, Multicentre Study, to Assess the Safety of Vismodegib (GDC-0449) in Patient With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC)

brief_summary.textblock: This single-arm, open-label, multi-center study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of vismodegib (GDC-0449) in patients with locally advanced or metastatic basal cell carcinoma. Patients will receive oral doses of vismodegib 150 mg once daily until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Any Adverse Events (AEs), AEs Grade 3 or 4, AEs Leading to Drug Interruptions or Discontinuations and Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events were graded according to National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03. Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care activity of daily living with inability to perform bathing, dressing and undressing, feeding self, using the toilet, taking medications but not bedridden. Grade 4: An immediate threat to life. Urgent medical intervention is required in order to maintain survival.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died Due to Adverse Events, Disease Progression or Other Reasons
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
primary_outcome.description: Reasons for "other" included "unknown," "natural causes," "cardiac decompensation," "general state alteration," "deterioration of general state," "clinical deterioration taking into consideration patient's age," "old age," and "disease progression of mediastinal squamous cell carcinoma (SCC)."

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Report a Shift in NCI CTCAE Grades to 3/4 in Hematology and Biochemistry Laboratory Parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Exposure to Study Treatment: Duration on Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
primary_outcome.description: Duration on treatment was the number of days between first and last dose of study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Exposure to Study Treatment - Dose Intensity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
primary_outcome.description: Dose intensity was defined as the percentage of actual number of doses received versus planned.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: BORR was defined as the percentage of participants achieving either a complete response (CR) or a partial response (PR) as assessed by the Investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) required a reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the time interval between the date of the earliest qualifying response (CR or PR) and the date of disease progression or death for any cause. Median duration of response was estimated using Kaplan-Meier estimates.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response was defined as the interval between the date of first treatment and the date of first documentation of confirmed CR or PR (whichever occur first).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time interval between the date of the first therapy and the date of progression or death for any causes, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was assessed by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the date of first treatment to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Scores of Skindex-16 Questionnaire Domains of Emotion, Function and Symptom
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years).
secondary_outcome.description: The Skindex-16 questionnaire includes three domains for the assessment of the effects of skin disease on participants' quality of life: symptoms, emotions and function. For each domain, responses from the questionnaire were transformed to a linear scale of 100 varying from 0 (never bothered, i.e., best) to 100 (always bothers, i.e., worst).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 30% Reduction in Disease-Related Symptoms According to MDASI Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 08-May-2013 (Protocol Version ≥ 4) to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (approximately 4 years and 1 month).
secondary_outcome.description: M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) scale. The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 30% Reduction in Composite Symptom Severity Score According to MDASI Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 08-May-2013 (Protocol Version ≥ 4) to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (approximately 4 years and 1 month).
secondary_outcome.description: M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) scale. The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.

arm_group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurs: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator. vismodegib: 150 mg once daily until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurs: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator. vismodegib: 150 mg once daily until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

intervention.description: 150 mg once daily until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/=18 years of age
- Metastatic or locally advanced basal cell carcinoma considered inoperable or that surgery is contraindicated and radiotherapy is contraindicated or inappropriate
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent anti-tumor therapy
- Completion of the most recent anti-tumor therapy less than 21 days prior to the initiation of treatment
- Uncontrolled medical illness

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 1232 participants were enrolled in the study, but only 1215 received at least one dose of any study treatment. Results include only the treated 1215 participants. Not Done category includes participants who did not complete the final end of study completion CRF page, including those who withdrew due to termination of the study.

group.title: Vismodegib - Locally Advanced
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

group.title: Vismodegib - Metastatic
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

group.title: Total

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.population: Race data was not collected for participants enrolled from France as per local regulations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Any Adverse Events (AEs), AEs Grade 3 or 4, AEs Leading to Drug Interruptions or Discontinuations and Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Adverse events were graded according to National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03. Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care activity of daily living with inability to perform bathing, dressing and undressing, feeding self, using the toilet, taking medications but not bedridden. Grade 4: An immediate threat to life. Urgent medical intervention is required in order to maintain survival.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)

measure.title: Exposure to Study Treatment - Dose Intensity
measure.description: Dose intensity was defined as the percentage of actual number of doses received versus planned.

outcome.title: Best Overall Response Rate (BORR)
outcome.description: BORR was defined as the percentage of participants achieving either a complete response (CR) or a partial response (PR) as assessed by the Investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) required a reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed measurable disease at baseline.

group.title: Vismodegib - Locally Advanced

measure.title: Best Overall Response Rate (BORR)
measure.description: BORR was defined as the percentage of participants achieving either a complete response (CR) or a partial response (PR) as assessed by the Investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) required a reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.
measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed measurable disease at baseline.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the time interval between the date of the earliest qualifying response (CR or PR) and the date of disease progression or death for any cause. Median duration of response was estimated using Kaplan-Meier estimates.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease, measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable) and reported a response of CR or PR.

group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease, measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable) and reported a response of CR or PR.

outcome.title: Time to Response
outcome.description: Time to response was defined as the interval between the date of first treatment and the date of first documentation of confirmed CR or PR (whichever occur first).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed measurable disease at baseline.

measure.description: Time to response was defined as the interval between the date of first treatment and the date of first documentation of confirmed CR or PR (whichever occur first).
measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed measurable disease at baseline.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time interval between the date of the first therapy and the date of progression or death for any causes, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was assessed by the investigator.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease and measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable).

group.title: Vismodegib - Locally Advanced
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time interval between the date of the first therapy and the date of progression or death for any causes, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was assessed by the investigator.
measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease and measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable).

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the date of first treatment to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years)
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease and measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable).

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: OS was defined as the time from the date of first treatment to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.
measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease and measureable disease status at baseline (measureable or non-measureable).

measurement_list.measurement: Median OS and 95% CI were not estimable due to low proportion of events.
Median OS and 95% CI were not estimable due to low proportion of events.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Scores of Skindex-16 Questionnaire Domains of Emotion, Function and Symptom
outcome.description: The Skindex-16 questionnaire includes three domains for the assessment of the effects of skin disease on participants' quality of life: symptoms, emotions and function. For each domain, responses from the questionnaire were transformed to a linear scale of 100 varying from 0 (never bothered, i.e., best) to 100 (always bothers, i.e., worst).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (up to 6 years).
outcome.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease at baseline. For each time point, Number Analyzed refers to patients with non-missing values.

group.title: Vismodegib - Locally Advanced
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

group.title: Vismodegib - Metastatic
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

measure.title: Change From Baseline Scores of Skindex-16 Questionnaire Domains of Emotion, Function and Symptom
measure.description: The Skindex-16 questionnaire includes three domains for the assessment of the effects of skin disease on participants' quality of life: symptoms, emotions and function. For each domain, responses from the questionnaire were transformed to a linear scale of 100 varying from 0 (never bothered, i.e., best) to 100 (always bothers, i.e., worst).
measure.population: Only included participants that had histologically confirmed disease at baseline. For each time point, Number Analyzed refers to patients with non-missing values.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 30% Reduction in Disease-Related Symptoms According to MDASI Scale
outcome.description: M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) scale. The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.
outcome.time_frame: 08-May-2013 (Protocol Version ≥ 4) to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (approximately 4 years and 1 month).
outcome.population: Included only participants who were enrolled after Protocol Version 4 was implemented, had non-missing data and baseline score ≥4. Per protocol, the MDASI measurements were measured in Metastatic patients only.

group.title: Vismodegib - Metastatic
group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 30% Reduction in Disease-Related Symptoms According to MDASI Scale
measure.description: M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) scale. The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.
measure.population: Included only participants who were enrolled after Protocol Version 4 was implemented, had non-missing data and baseline score ≥4. Per protocol, the MDASI measurements were measured in Metastatic patients only.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 30% Reduction in Composite Symptom Severity Score According to MDASI Scale
outcome.description: M.D. Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) scale. The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.
outcome.time_frame: 08-May-2013 (Protocol Version ≥ 4) to the data cut-off date of 14 June 2017 (approximately 4 years and 1 month).
outcome.population: Included only participants who were enrolled after Protocol Version 4 was implemented, had non-missing data and average baseline score ≥ 4. Per protocol, the MDASI measurements were measured in Metastatic patients only.

group.description: Participants received vismodegib 150 mg orally once a day until one of the following occurred: Disease progression, intolerable toxicity most probably attributable to vismodegib, consent withdrawal, death, study termination by the Sponsor, or other reason deemed by the Investigator.

The MDASI core instrument is a 19-item patient self-report questionnaire whose items comprise two scales, symptom severity and symptom interference. For 13 items (i.e., pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distress, shortness of breath, difficulty remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsiness, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, and numbness or tingling), participants were asked to rate how severe the symptoms were when "at their worst" in the last 24 hours. For the remaining 6 items, participants were asked to rate how much the symptoms have interfered with 6 areas of functioning (i.e., general activity, walking, work, mood, relations with other people, and enjoyment of life) in the last 24 hours.
measure.population: Included only participants who were enrolled after Protocol Version 4 was implemented, had non-missing data and average baseline score ≥ 4. Per protocol, the MDASI measurements were measured in Metastatic patients only.

event.sub_title: INFECTIVE EXACERBATION OF CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE AIRWAYS DISEASE

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
